title: Which car makers will survive the electric revolution?
text:
The car industry is bracing for more over the next few years than it has experienced in the past century as the electric revolution combines with the advent of self-driving technology and other innovations such as vehicle sharing systems.

The pivot to electric is already upon us and is likely to trigger a period of rapid consolidation, according to Professor David Bailey, an automotive industry expert at Birmingham University.

Developing electric vehicles (EVs) requires huge investment and not every company will be able to afford it, he says. “That means not everyone will survive – we’re already seeing alliances, partnerships and tie-ups as manufacturers look for ways to cut costs."
